para.text: Requirement. A person required to obtain and maintain a license as set forth under COMAR 10.10.03 shall pay the appropriate fees as set forth in this chapter.
A person shall submit a licensing fee in the form of a check or money order made payable to the Maryland Department of Health.
Fees. Fees include but are not limited to the following:
Provide a copy of COMAR 10.10.01—.10.10.09, "Medical Laboratories" — as provided under COMAR 10.01.08; and

For the Department to conduct out-of-State, on-site surveys of a laboratory seeking or maintaining a license to test specimens of a type and in a scientific field of study for which there is no national certification, for example, the subdiscipline of job-related testing of hair for drugs of abuse — full cost to the Department.
Public Health Laboratory. A public health laboratory, as defined in COMAR 10.10.01.03, is exempt from paying fees under this chapter.
Fee Waiver. The Secretary may waive all licensing fees for a:
Municipal or county health department; or
Governmental agency that receives funding to operate from the State.

Payment of Prorated Fees. A licensee issued a letter of exception or a permit at a time other than at the beginning of a regulatory cycle shall pay a letter of exception or permit fee based on the total number of full plus partial months remaining in a regulatory cycle on the date a permit or letter of exception is issued.
Refunds and Credits. The Secretary may not issue a refund or credit or return any licensing application fees to a laboratory that:
Replaces a permit with a letter of exception; or
Voluntarily or involuntarily ceases to operate or reduces or limits a testing service before a license expires.
Failure to Pay Fees. The Secretary may not issue a new license or issue a renewed license until all outstanding fees are paid.
Letter of Exception. A person applying for a letter of exception for a POL or POCL shall submit an initial application and biennially after that with each renewal application.

Letter of Exception — Limited Testing for Rare Diseases. A person applying for a letter of exception-limited testing for rare diseases for a laboratory shall submit an initial application and biennially after that with each renewal application.
